game.engine

Class Character

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.engine.Character

  • public class Character
extends java.lang.Object
    The children which are playing the game. Created by flavia on 02.03.17.

        public Tile getTile()
        The Tile on which this Character is.

      • setStartingTile

        public boolean setStartingTile(Tile startingTile)
        Sets the Character on the specified Tile, only if the Character hadn't had a Tile before.
        Returns:
        true if it was successful, false if the character already had a Tile.

      • getWeapon

        public Weapon getWeapon()

      • setWeapon

      • getWetness

        public int getWetness()

      • changeWetness

        public void changeWetness(int wetnessChange)
        This adds or removes wetness and checks whether the Character is still in the game.
        Parameters:
        wetnessChange - By how much the wetness changes. Can be negative to remove wetness.

      • getMoveRange

        public int getMoveRange()
        Returns:
        The maximum move Range of the Character in Tiles.

      • getActionPoints

        public int getActionPoints()
        Returns:
        actionPoints

      • getMaximumActionPoints

        public int getMaximumActionPoints()
        Returns:
        maximumActionPoints

      • changeMaximumActionPoints

        public void changeMaximumActionPoints(int maximumActionPointsChange)

      • removeActionPoints

        public boolean removeActionPoints(int actionPointsToRemove)
        Removes the given value from actionPoints ONLY IF there are enough actionPoints left. Called in an if statement before carrying out the action inside the if statement. In the else part optionally a message can be displayed to the player (e.g. "not enough action points!").
        Parameters:
        actionPointsToRemove - How much actionPoints the action cost.
        Returns:
        true if the action could be carried out and the actionPoints were removed, false if there weren't enough action points and the action could not be carried out.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()

      • getAttackRangeInTiles

        public java.util.Set<Tile> getAttackRangeInTiles()
        Returns:
        The Attack range calculated with Tile.getAllTilesInRange(int, boolean) from this Character's Weapon's range. Can be null!

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • KillCharacter

        public void KillCharacter()
        UNDONE! This Method removes the Character from play and drops all their stuff on the ground. It also checks the winning conditions and ends the game if necessary.

      • moveCharacter

        public boolean moveCharacter(int direction)
        Moves the Character by one Tile.
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction (N==0; E==1; S==2; W==3) where to move.
        Returns:
        Whether the move was successful true or not false (e.g. blocked by sth).

      • moveCharacterTo

        public boolean moveCharacterTo(Tile destinationTile,
                               int distance)
        Moves the Character to the specific Tile if it is walkable.
        Parameters:
        destinationTile - The Tile to move to.
        distance - The distance between the Characters current Tile and the destinationTile.
        Returns:
        true if successful, false otherwise.

      • getAllEnemyCharactersInRange

        public java.util.HashSet<Character> getAllEnemyCharactersInRange()

      • isOnSameTeamAs

        public boolean isOnSameTeamAs(Character otherCharacter)
        Parameters:
        otherCharacter - another Character. (Could also be the same Character)
        Returns:
        true if they're both on the same Team, false otherwise.

      • resetForNewTurn

        public void resetForNewTurn()
        This method should be called by the owner for every Character, when the owner begins their turn.
